xxl.core.indexStructures
Class RevisedRTree

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.indexStructures.Tree
      xxl.core.indexStructures.ORTree
          xxl.core.indexStructures.RTree
              xxl.core.indexStructures.RevisedRTree

public class RevisedRTree
extends RTree

Revised R*-Tree For a detailed discussion see Norbert Beckmann, Bernhard Seeger: "A Rivised R*-Tree in Comparsion with Related Index Structures"

See Also:
RTree

Nested Class Summary
 class RevisedRTree.Node
          Node is the class used to represent leaf- and non-leaf nodes of RTree.
 class RevisedRTree.NodeConverter
          The instances of this class are converters to write nodes to the external storage (or any other DataOutput) or read them from it (or any other DataInput).

Method Detail

initialize

public ORTree initialize(Function getDescriptor,
                         Container container,
                         int blockSize,
                         int dataSize,
                         int descriptorSize,
                         double minMaxFactor)
Description copied from class: ORTree
Before the tree is usable, it must be initialized. This version of initialize takes basic informations about the size of the blocks and entries and calculates the capacity of inner and leaf nodes.

Overrides:
initialize in class ORTree
Parameters:
getDescriptor - the new Tree.getDescriptor
container - the new Tree.determineContainer
blockSize - the size of a block of the container in bytes
dataSize - the size of an data object in bytes
descriptorSize - the size of a Descriptor returned by getDescriptor in bytes
minMaxFactor - the quotient between minimum and maximum number of entries in an node, e.g. 0.5
Returns:
the initialized tree
Since:
1.1
See Also:
ORTree.initialize(Function, Container, int, int, int, double)

query

public Cursor query(Descriptor queryDescriptor,
                    int targetLevel)
This method is an implemtation of an efficient querying algorithm. The result is a lazy Cursor pointing to all objects whose descriptors overlap with the given queryDescriptor. ( This is original algorithmus of ORTree.query, it is only differs in remove method. updates Middle point to the center of recomputed MBB)

Overrides:
query in class ORTree
Parameters:
queryDescriptor - describes the query in terms of a descriptor
targetLevel - the tree-level to provide the answer-objects
Returns:
a lazy cursor pointing to all response objects
